The materials in this family with M = Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Zn have an orthorhombic structure (space group Pnna), in which the pseudocubic perovskite cell is distorted slightly along the face diagonal. In this structure, alternate planes of guanidinium ions are tilted in different directions, forming a herringbone pattern ( figure 1 b). By contrast, CdGF adopts a rhombohedral structure (space group
R
3 ¯
c
) in which the pseudocubic cell is distorted along the body diagonal [ 29]. In this form, each guanidinium ion lies in a parallel plane ( figure 1 c).
